title: How to Make Potato Popiah

steps.headline: Heat oil and fry dried shrimp till fragrant and then add small red onions and sauté till onion is semi cook.
Add garlic, shredded meat, and diced potato.
Add in chicken stock (enough to cover the mixture), oyster sauce, and pepper.
Bring the mixture to boil and then simmer over medium heat for about 5 minutes.
Lay the popiah skin on a flat surface.
Add in the filling.
steps.description: Add only a little bit in the middle to prevent the filling from spilling out later/

steps.headline: Gently roll the mixture with the ends folded inwards.
Ensure that the popiah skin does not tear.
steps.description: If it does, you can still cook the dish, but it won't be as presentable.

steps.headline: Fry the popiah till it is golden brown.
Finished.
steps.description: Drain the oil and pat the excess oil away.

text: Making the Filling Heat oil and fry dried shrimp till fragrant and then add small red onions and sauté till onion is semi cook.  Add garlic, shredded meat, and diced potato. Mix well for about 1 minute. Add in chicken stock (enough to cover the mixture), oyster sauce, and pepper.  Bring the mixture to boil and then simmer over medium heat for about 5 minutes.  Drain and set aside.  Making the Popiah Lay the popiah skin on a flat surface.  Add in the filling. Add only a little bit in the middle to prevent the filling from spilling out later/ Gently roll the mixture with the ends folded inwards.  Ensure that the popiah skin does not tear. If it does, you can still cook the dish, but it won't be as presentable. Fry the popiah till it is golden brown.  Finished. Drain the oil and pat the excess oil away.
